instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPU’s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP1V5_S3RS0: What is PP1V5_S3RS0? PP1V5_S3RS0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT? PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT is a 0.75v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board has liquid damage and got rust around <CAPACITOR>C7272</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C7273</CAPACITOR> and also around F7040 area.<CAPACITOR>C7272</CAPACITOR> actually came off with corroded solder pad. But pin 16 of <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> seems to be ok as it still generates <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.

Green light. No fan spin. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> are OK.

checked <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> at pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C1680</CAPACITOR> and it is 0v. Resistance to ground is 8ohm. 
                    
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL> = 0v (should be 1.05v)
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_CPU_VCCDQ</SIGNAL> = 0.35v  (should be 1.5v)              
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_CPU_VCCPQE</SIGNAL> = 1.05v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0_CPU_VCCPLL_R</SIGNAL> = 1.8v
L7100 = 0.9v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>.
Post <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> voltage; pins 15, 24, 40, 1, 2.
Use surrounding components as test points; don't touch chip pins!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is fine

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP>:
Pin 15 = 4.96v
Pin 24 = 4.96v
Pin 40 = 4.96v
Pin 1 = 0.06v
Pin 2 = 12.33v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
No <SIGNAL>1V5_S3</SIGNAL>, implies missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Post <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> voltage; pins 12, 6, 16, 17.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Post resistance to ground at L7330.
If good, change <CHIP>U7300</CHIP>.
Be sure all traces and surrounding components are good; as solders too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: L7330 resistance to ground is 5.25K.Is it good or bad?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
No short, better to check in diode mode.
You should get voltage there; change <CHIP>U7300</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
diode mode reading 341. Voltage is 1.48v

So I have <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> but no <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3RS0</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_CPU_VCCDQ</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1702</RESISTOR> is good. Diode mode reading is 144.

But voltage is only 0.35v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 3.3v diode mode = 347
<SIGNAL>ISOLATE_CPU_MEM_L</SIGNAL> = 0v diode mode = 460

Just in case... I re-measured all of the power rails on page 7 again and here are the strange one:
                
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.05v
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3RS0</SIGNAL> = 0.35v
<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> = 0v       (Is this because <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> Pin 17=0v ?)       
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_FW_FWPHY</SIGNAL> = 0v                 
<SIGNAL>PP1V0_FW_FWPHY</SIGNAL> = 0v                  
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>  = 0v             
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>   = 0v          
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_CPU_VCCDQ</SIGNAL> = 0.35v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you get L7630 voltage?
If yes, remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> and check <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
L7630 = 1.05V

Let me try to remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> and report.
